pr_title: Add option --emit-json to kprove as well

timeline.message: pyk/kast: assume extension is included in requires when pretty printing

timeline.author: ehildenb

timeline.message: tests/pyk/build-config: correct for differnt way of building definition

timeline.bodyText:
I have a few issues here:

compiled._1() returns an entire definition, not only a module, so the name of the file is not really correct.
Right now, each time you call kprove you may have a different set of claims, so maybe it would be better if you save this in kprove.temp. I know we want to eventually optimize this step, so it might not matter then. Thoughts?
timeline.author: radumereuta

replies.bodyText: Hmmmm, saving in kprove.temp may be difficult, because I need to access the file afterward. How about I let the user specify the location with --emit-json-file some_file_name, and otherwise default to *-kompiled/kprove-definition.json?
replies.author: ehildenb

replies.bodyText: That sounds even more complicated. I'm happy with where it saves right now if we are to fix kprove eventually.
replies.author: radumereuta

replies.bodyText: Ok, it works for me for now anyway then.
replies.author: ehildenb

replies.bodyText: But you should still change the name of the file to reflect that you have a definition inside, not just a module.
replies.author: radumereuta
